title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improving
description: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improving. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. When prompted with the message 'Do you want to save the changes?', selecting 'Yes' would save the changes, 'No' would discard the changes, and 'Cancel' would do nothing and remain on the Source page. Additionally, the error dialog is titled 'Error'.
OB: When switching back to the Layout view from the 'source' view of the Layout Editor after editing the XML, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The error message states 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: When switching back to the Layout view from the 'source' view of the Layout Editor after editing the XML, the changes should be automatically saved or the user should be prompted with a clear message asking if they want to save or discard the changes.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message indicating that the changes need to be saved.
